pullRequest.body:
Added lemma that the number of odd components contained within a component
in a bigger graph is odd iff the bigger component is odd. In preparation for Tuttes.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [5737f9d4d2](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15539/commits/5737f9d4d2aa69bcf98688d6babc5cd57fa7df76)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ConnectedComponent.odd_card_supp_iff_odd_subcomponents`
`+ biUnion_supp_eq_supp`
`+ connectedComponentMk_supp_subset_supp`
`+ disjiUnion_supp_toFinset_eq_supp_toFinset`
`+ isEmpty`
`+ top_supp_eq_univ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Just backmerged master. Originally I refactored `odd_card_iff_odd_components`, but it had been shown that it could do without [DecidableEq V], and I do think it's needed for the subcomponent variant, so I kept the old stronger result.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10576902153/job/29303708578)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10576902153/job/29303709334)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Golfed the proof a bit. Thanks!

maintainer merge
Sorry, I started a review two weeks ago, but it was apparently never published

Golfed the proof a bit. Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Any reason why you are nesting set comprehensions here?
```suggestion
    {c : ConnectedComponent G | c.supp âŠ† c'.supp âˆ§ Odd (Nat.card c.1.supp)}) := by
```
Mainly because I couldn't figure out how to rewrite between these two forms in using it :see_no_evil:
I think you never need your original form. You must have thought you needed it because of your statement of `union_supp_eq_supp`, but my suggestion below should fix this
Fixed:)

Maybe
```suggestion
lemma biUnion_supp_eq_supp {G G' : SimpleGraph V} (h : G â‰¤ G') (c' : ConnectedComponent G') :
    â‹ƒ (c : ConnectedComponent G) (hc : c.supp âŠ† c'.supp}, c.1.supp = c'.supp := by
```

I tried this, two remarks:

- Is biUnion the right name for this? This is just a double union, whereas the biUnion is over a set, right?
- I'm having trouble using the lemma because the motive is incorrect. Previously I managed to fix this by adding the `DecidablePred`, but I don't really know how to get there now.

Managed to get this to work, but I'm guessing we want to do some golfing/extraction before merging. In particular the argument to Finset.filter_congr seems a prime candidate. Any thoughts what we would want to do there?

> * Is biUnion the right name for this? This is just a double union, whereas the biUnion is over a set, right?

`biUnion` is precisely the special case of `iUnionâ‚‚` where the inner `iUnion` runs over a Prop
Do you think you could golf the lemma above using this one? (by setting `G' := âŠ¤`
Done. In number of lines it's not much better, but I'm guessing there's some golfing possibilities

```suggestion
  cases isEmpty_or_nonempty V
```
is more idiomatic
Fixed:)

I guess here I meant `cases'` since we don't want to name the hypothesis
```suggestion
  cases' isEmpty_or_nonempty V
```
Changed, though I didn't know how to do the second part without naming the hypothesis, so I added a `with` to it

Maybe you could even try using `inhabit`?
```suggestion
  inhabit V
```
I don't think this is relevant anymore since I reverted back on the old proof to get rid of the dependency on `[DecidableEq V]`, but I'll keep it in mind for future applications

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Combinatorics/SimpleGraph): Add lemma about number of odd subcomponents
